alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 9:59AM CST until February 11 at 4:36PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 44.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CST Monday was 44.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 47.2 feet Wednesday morning. The river is then forecast to gradually fall to below flood stage by late Friday morning and continue falling to 37.3 feet by Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
